content.1: Let a man so account of us, as of the ministers of Christ, and stewards of the mysteries of God.
content.2: Moreover it is required in stewards, that a man be found faithful.
content.3: But with me it is a very small thing that I should be judged of you, or of man’s judgment: yea, I judge not mine own self.
content.4: For I know nothing by myself; yet am I not hereby justified: but he that judgeth me is the Lord.
content.5: Therefore judge nothing before the time, until the Lord come, who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness, and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts: and then shall every man have praise of God.

content.8: Now ye are full, now ye are rich, ye have reigned as kings without us: and I would to God ye did reign, that we also might reign with you.
content.9: For I think that God hath set forth us the apostles last, as it were appointed to death: for we are made a spectacle unto the world, and to angels, and to men.
content.11: Even unto this present hour we both hunger, and thirst, and are naked, and are buffeted, and have no certain dwellingplace;
content.12: And labour, working with our own hands: being reviled, we bless; being persecuted, we suffer it:
content.13: Being defamed, we intreat: we are made as the filth of the world,
content.14: I write not these things to shame you, but as my beloved sons I warn
content.15: For though ye have ten thousand instructers in Christ, yet
content.16: Wherefore I beseech you, be ye followers of me.
content.17: For this cause have I sent unto you Timotheus, who is my beloved son, and faithful in the Lord, who shall bring you into remembrance of my ways which be in Christ, as I teach every where in every church.
content.18: Now some are puffed up, as though I would not come to you.
content.19: But I will come to you shortly, if the Lord will, and will know, not the speech of them which are puffed up, but the power.
